blog.name: gabriel-strange
blog.title: maybe i'm crazy
blog.description: 24, just a regular straight chilean geeky guy who likes comics, movies, video games, mlp, wild cards and do drawings and animations. also i love brony bacon , the brony community will understand what do i mean ;). and i reaaaaaally have a soft spot for martial arts comics; besides being an animation student, im an aspiring screenwriter, anti-sjw to the bone. Sometimes NSFW, if you want to see my full NSFW Blog, just ask nicely

blog.name: johnnyclash87
blog.title: Fandoms Books Social Consciousness
blog.description:
I'll come up with a better title eventually.

Short and sweet I'm a nerd/geek. I listen to punk. I'm a feminist. I'm an lgbtq ally. I'm a wanna be superhero/adventurer. Because I talk a lot about race and racism I should probably clarify that I’m white and male.?

One of the things I love is how speculative fiction can be used to talk about serious topics. Which is what this will mostly be about. Along with just some fun things.

summary: Poe and Finn and Roses plan would have worked.
body:
Poe and Finn and Roses plan would have worked.

And it wouldn’t have cost them all the Resistances capital ships.

The only reason why it didn’t was because of bad luck and bad character writing.

Finn and Rose risk getting a parking ticket? Are you serious? And of course the most overzealous citizen on the one planet that jails people for parking violations happens to see them.

And then the one time in the history of people in Star Wars sneaking into enemy territory, they get caught.. And even though he’s shown himself to be pretty amoral, Finn and Rose think nothing of talking about Holdos plan within earshot of DJ. Who of course sells them out.

The one thing I’d say was uncontrollably risky was even if they had found the Codebreaker, if Finn and Rose were caught they could likely have been tortured and mind probed for information. But they know very little information to give up anyway which is probably why Phasma just has them executed. And if the Resistance stopped every mission because someone might get captured, they’d never accomplish anything.

blog.name: radioactivepeasant
blog.title: Nobody Panic!
blog.description:
Adventures in fandom and creative writing

Here, you'll find a lot of fandom-related posts...and a heck of a lot of writing. So much writing. I do writing prompts just about every weekday, Monday to Friday.

What you're not going to find are posts that insult others or put people down. There's enough of that in the real world: I don't need any on my blog, thanks.

tags: in which Owen and Beru moved after multiple years of moisture farming failures
in which Owen discovers that he likes fixing up old ships as much as his nephew and he gets pretty darn good at it
in which Vader was not asking for this headache
Owen is going to think at first that Vader figured out they help the Rebels on the side
because tumblr ate the last one
body:
Fic Prompts: Star Wars Wednesday

(Different plot than the one I wrote last night…that Tumblr Mobile ATE.)

There was cheerful whistling coming from the hangar, and already Darth Vader wanted to strangle someone. The only reason he restrained himself was that the Force was practically screaming in his ears that something significant was about to happen. He could sense a strong Force Sensitive in the area, shockingly close. But the usual surge of the Dark Side that would prepare him to deal with the threat had been muted by the much louder call of the living Force.

Willing himself not to begin indiscriminately destroying things – or worse, tinkering with them out of pure boredom – Vader stalked into the hangar to find out just what was taking the shuttle repairs so long. There was a faint sense that there was some deliberate misleading going on here, and he resolved to have the local garrison investigate them for Rebel connections when they were done.

“Ah, s-sorry about the wait,” a skinny, nervous looking man gulped upon seeing him, “We were near finished putting in that new fuel line, but the boss or his nephew always look things over before we tell a customer it’s done.”

“I will be the judge of whether it has been completed satisfactorily,” Vader growled. “You had best hope that you are competent in your position.”

He pushed past several mechanics and ducked to get under the wing of the shuttle. The Force was practically shaking him by the lapels now. Whatever he was looking for, whatever was stirring up the Force like this, it was right in front of him.

There was a boy, no more than seventeen, eighteen years of age, with sun-bleached hair and stained coveralls that might have once been a flight suit. He barely seemed to notice Vader at first, so intent was he on whatever it was he was doing – which was most definitely not inspecting a fuel line.

“What do you think you are doing?” Darth Vader confronted him sharply.

The boy jolted, scraping his hands badly against the inside of the loading ramp. He hissed in pain and shook off a few droplets of blood, then amazingly, went right back to what he was doing.

“Did you know you’ve got a busted gear in the hydraulics for the ramp?” he asked in a surprisingly level voice. “It’s small now, but it’s one of those things that does cumulative damage if you leave it unaddressed. I figured I’d replace it while the shuttle was here. Don’t worry, Uncle Owen never adds my extra repairs to the bill.”

Upon examination, Vader could grudgingly admit that the boy was right. And despite himself, he was faintly impressed. You had to know what you were doing to spot that kind of issue without a droid running a diagnostic for you.

“This is an asteroid colony with limited supplies. Just what were you intending to use as a replacement gear?” he asked, more curious than he wanted to be.

“Well, most Sienar Fleet Systems products take really specific parts. Aunt Beru says it’s probably so they can charge more for repairs, and I tend to believe her. But they’ve been using the same standard gear for the Lambda class shuttle since the borrowed half the design from the Clone Wars. It’s not too difficult to improvise a replacement part in an pinch.”

“You know your ships,” Vader admitted grudgingly.

“I love flying,” the boy answered honestly, his answer shining almost literally in the Force with his enthusiasm. “And I have a soft spot for Lambdas, since that’s what got my family off of Tatooine.” He grimaced as he said the name of the planet, as if he’d bitten down on something unpleasant. Surprisingly, Vader could relate.

“You are bleeding in my hydraulics system,” he observed dryly.

“Aw kriff, I am! I’m sorry!” The boy yanked his hands back and grabbed for a cleaning rag to dab at the little, bright droplets.

And then it finally seemed to hit him that he was standing under a shuttle, talking shop with Darth Vader.

The young man rocketed back and stared up at him with wide, suspicious eyes, every muscle tensed to run. Surprising that it had taken that long. But Darth Vader was less focused on his behavior than on his face. Now that he got a good look at him, now that he could actually see his features, there was a terrible similarity. An impossible similarity. This was absolutely what the Force had been all but howling about, but why-? Who-?

“Who are you?” he demanded, taking a step forward.

“L-l-luke Skywalker,” the boy stammered, wiping blood, oil, and other mechanical fluids off on his pant legs.

“What?!”

Luke swallowed hard, and tried again. “M-my name is Luke Skywalker…my uncle runs the repair business?” His voice was barely more than a whispered squeak.

For some reason, this seemed to enrage Vader. Luke tried to present a smaller target as the man – was he a man? He wasn’t a droid, right? – took another menacing step forward.

“Who are your parents?” he hissed.

“Um his…my father’s name was Anakin, I…don’t know my mother’s name,” Luke gulped, wondering why that had any bearing on the situation, “They died when I was a baby…”

As best Vader could tell from the Force, nothing the young man was saying was a lie. But that was impossible! Utterly impossible! Someone was lying here. Perhaps the boy believed what he was saying, but that didn’t make it true. But there was a way to find out. He grabbed Luke by the shoulder and hauled him out from under the shuttle with him.

“We are going to have a conversation with this uncle of yours,” he said in a decidedly threatening tone.

Luke could not possibly have been more confused.

Willing himself not to begin indiscriminately destroying things – or worse, tinkering with them out of pure boredom – Vader stalked into the hangar to find out just what was taking the shuttle repairs so long. There was a faint sense that there was some deliberate misleading going on here, and he resolved to have the local garrison investigate them for Rebel connections when they were done.

“Ah, s-sorry about the wait,” a skinny, nervous looking man gulped upon seeing him, “We were near finished putting in that new fuel line, but the boss or his nephew always look things over before we tell a customer it’s done.”

caption: Heavy Metal Star Wars Battle

summary: So Dave Filoni is allegedly directing two episodes of the upcoming Jon Favreau live-action Star Wars series (possibly even...
body:
So Dave Filoni is allegedly directing two episodes of the upcoming Jon Favreau live-action Star Wars series (possibly even including the premiere episode). Said series is rumoured to be about Mandalorians a couple of years after Return of the Jedi.

I have to wonder… if this is indeed the case, is it possible we could get a live-action Sabine Wren at some point, or if it’s too much just some of the other Wrens? I mean, if Filoni is indeed directing it’s possible he wrote on episodes too, and from what it sounds like he’s very involved in anything regarding the characters from The Clone Wars and Rebels so if live-action Sabine is gonna show up anywhere, it would be on a show he’s directly involved with.

I guess I just wonder that even if this is certainly possible Sabine could appear in live-action, I have to wonder how the timeline would add up given she’s also looking for Ezra at this time, and I doubt that’s going to be a thing in this show (I doubt Sabine would even be anymore than a guest star). I guess if there’s plans that would make this difficult there’s also the possibility of a character like Bo-Katan or Fenn Rau showing up (and the actors from Rebels can actually play them in live-action)?

Who knows if any of this will even be confirmed, but if Filoni is indeed directing on this show, I have to wonder if these things are in the realm of possibility.

So Dave Filoni is allegedly directing two episodes of the upcoming Jon Favreau live-action Star Wars series (possibly even including the premiere episode). Said series is rumoured to be about Mandalorians a couple of years after Return of the Jedi.

I have to wonder… if this is indeed the case, is it possible we could get a live-action Sabine Wren at some point, or if it’s too much just some of the other Wrens? I mean, if Filoni is indeed directing it’s possible he wrote on episodes too, and from what it sounds like he’s very involved in anything regarding the characters from The Clone Wars and Rebels so if live-action Sabine is gonna show up anywhere, it would be on a show he’s directly involved with.

I guess if there’s plans that would make this difficult there’s also the possibility of a character like Bo-Katan or Fenn Rau showing up (and the actors from Rebels can actually play them in live-action)?

Who knows if any of this will even be confirmed, but if Filoni is indeed directing on this show, I have to wonder if these things are in the realm of possibility.

blog.name: mordicaifeed
blog.title: Mordicai!
blog.description: I was, besides, endued with a figure hideously deformed & loathsome; I was not even of the same nature as man. I was more agile than they & could subsist upon coarser diet; I bore the extremes of heat & cold with less injury to my frame; my stature far exceeded theirs. When I looked around, I saw & heard of none like me.
